WITNESS STATEMENT OF ALICE THOMPSON

I, Alice Thompson, state the following:

On the evening of January 10, 2024, I observed Mr. Smith arrive at the property at approximately 7:30 PM. He was alone and appeared calm. I watched him enter through the front door.

I remained at my window for the next two hours. Mr. Smith did not leave the property during this time. I am certain of these facts.

Signed: Alice Thompson
Date: January 15, 2024

WITNESS STATEMENT OF BOB CARTER

I, Bob Carter, make the following statement:

On January 10, 2024, I met with Mr. Smith at The Crown pub at 8:00 PM. We had several drinks together and discussed business matters. Mr. Smith remained at the pub until approximately 10:30 PM when he left alone.

I am prepared to testify to these facts in court.

Signed: Bob Carter
Date: January 16, 2024

POLICE INVESTIGATION REPORT

Case Reference: MET/2024/00456
Officer: PC Sarah Johnson

At 9:45 PM on January 10, 2024, emergency services responded to a call from 42 Oak Street. Upon arrival at 10:02 PM, officers found Mr. Smith unconscious in the living room of the property.

CCTV footage from the neighboring property confirms Mr. Smith entered the house at 9:30 PM and did not leave before our arrival.

The investigation is ongoing.

MEDICAL EXPERT REPORT

Prepared by: Dr. Emily Watson, MB ChB, MRCP
Date: February 1, 2024

FINDINGS:

Based on my examination of the patient records and physical examination on January 25, 2024, I conclude that the injuries observed are consistent with a single fall from standing height.

The bruising pattern shows no indication of repeated trauma. The injuries are approximately 48-72 hours old at the time of examination.

There is no medical evidence to support allegations of prolonged abuse.

HOSPITAL ADMISSION RECORD

Patient ID: CGH-2024-00892
Admission Date: January 22, 2024, 3:45 PM

PRESENTING COMPLAINT:
Patient presented with multiple bruises in varying stages of healing. Nursing staff noted discoloration patterns consistent with injuries sustained over a period of 2-3 weeks.

INITIAL ASSESSMENT:
Oldest bruises appear to be approximately 3 weeks old. Newer injuries observed on upper arms and torso.

Patient appeared anxious and reluctant to discuss cause of injuries.

SOCIAL WORK ASSESSMENT

Social Worker: James Miller
Date of Visit: January 28, 2024
Case Reference: SW/2024/1234

HOME CONDITIONS:
The property was found to be in excellent condition. All areas were clean and well-maintained. The children's bedrooms were appropriately furnished with adequate space.

CHILD WELFARE:
Both children appeared healthy, well-nourished, and appropriately dressed. They demonstrated positive attachment to their father.

RECOMMENDATION:
No concerns identified. Contact arrangements should continue as currently ordered.

SOCIAL WORK ASSESSMENT - FOLLOW UP

Social Worker: James Miller
Date of Visit: February 18, 2024
Case Reference: SW/2024/1234

HOME CONDITIONS:
Serious concerns were noted regarding the state of the property. The home was found to be unclean with evidence of poor hygiene standards. Children's bedrooms were cluttered and inadequate.

CHILD WELFARE:
The children appeared tired and anxious. Concerns noted about their emotional wellbeing.

RECOMMENDATION:
Immediate safeguarding review recommended. Contact arrangements should be suspended pending further assessment.

COURT TRANSCRIPT

Case: FC/2024/5678
Date: March 1, 2024 (Morning Session)
Judge: Her Honour Judge Patricia Morgan

JUDGE: Mr. Williams, can you confirm your employment status?

MR. WILLIAMS: Yes, Your Honour. I have been continuously employed at Henderson Engineering since 2018. I have not had any gaps in employment.

JUDGE: And your annual salary?

MR. WILLIAMS: Approximately forty-five thousand pounds per year, Your Honour.

JUDGE: Thank you. The court will take this into consideration.

HENDERSON ENGINEERING LTD

HR Department
Date: February 25, 2024

TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN:

Re: Employment Verification - David Williams

We confirm that Mr. David Williams was employed by Henderson Engineering from March 2018 until October 2022, when his employment was terminated due to redundancy.

Mr. Williams was subsequently re-employed in a part-time capacity in June 2023, working 20 hours per week at a salary of twenty-two thousand pounds per annum (pro-rata).

Yours faithfully,
Sarah Henderson, HR Director

WITNESS STATEMENT

I, Carol Davis, state:

On the afternoon of January 5, 2024, I was walking my dog in Victoria Park. It was a bright, sunny day with clear skies. I clearly saw Mr. Roberts and Ms. Taylor arguing near the bandstand at approximately 2:30 PM.

The argument was heated and lasted several minutes. I could hear shouting from where I stood, approximately 50 meters away.

Signed: Carol Davis
Date: January 18, 2024

MET OFFICE WEATHER REPORT

Location: Victoria Park Area
Date: January 5, 2024

WEATHER CONDITIONS:

12:00 - 15:00: Heavy rainfall throughout the afternoon. Visibility reduced to approximately 100 meters due to persistent rain and low cloud cover.

Precipitation: 18mm recorded between 13:00 and 16:00.

Sunshine hours: 0.0

Notes: Weather warnings were in effect for the area. Met Office issued advisory for flooding.

POLICE INTERVIEW TRANSCRIPT

Interview of: Thomas Green
Date: February 10, 2024
Officers Present: DC Brown, DC Taylor

DC BROWN: Mr. Green, can you tell us about your relationship with the victim?

THOMAS GREEN: I had never met her before that night. She was a complete stranger to me. I was just walking past when I heard someone call for help.

DC BROWN: So you had no prior contact whatsoever?

THOMAS GREEN: None at all. I had never seen her before in my life.

DIGITAL FORENSICS REPORT

Analysis of Mobile Phone Records
Subject: Thomas Green
Date: February 15, 2024

FINDINGS:

Analysis of call records shows 47 calls and 312 text messages exchanged between Thomas Green's mobile phone and the victim's phone number over a period of 6 months prior to the incident.

The messaging pattern indicates a close relationship. Several messages reference previous in-person meetings.

Last contact prior to incident: February 8, 2024, 11:32 PM

EXPERT PSYCHOLOGICAL REPORT

Prepared by: Dr. Helen Burke, DClinPsy
Date: March 5, 2024

ASSESSMENT OF CHILD A

I conducted three assessment sessions with Child A over two weeks. My assessment included validated psychological instruments and clinical observation.

CONCLUSIONS:

Child A demonstrates secure attachment to both parents. There are no indicators of anxiety, trauma, or emotional disturbance.

Child A expressed no preference between parents and spoke positively about time spent with each parent.

I find no psychological evidence to support restricting contact with either parent.

CAFCASS REPORT

Children and Family Court Advisory and Support Service
Case Reference: CAF/2024/7890
Date: February 28, 2024

OBSERVATIONS:

During supervised contact sessions, Child A displayed significant anxiety when the father arrived. Child A physically withdrew and refused to engage.

Child A explicitly stated a preference to live solely with their mother and expressed fear about overnight stays with their father.

RECOMMENDATION:
Contact with father should be limited to supervised day visits only until further assessment.
